column4: hi.. i am trying to install the new ubuntu but i am getting this error.. http://www.flickr.com/photos/jr/3003476569/   any clue?
did you md5 check the cd?
i bet you have a bad disk
i have burned 2 different CD's from 2 different isos, downloaded from different servers
doesnt matter, use the md5 sum on the same server to check the iso you burned and then use the program on the cd to check the cd for defects
i will do that, thank u :)
ok then boot to the cd and check it theer too
if its ok, check the ram for issues
actually i am using Archlinux.. i can't even make the CD test.. i got right away the "Error reading boot CD"
this could be related with the fact i am using an ATI card?
when it drops run: dmesg | tail
you may also want to reboot and run:  dmesg | less     to see if a firmware file was expected
dmesg shows the kernel messages since boot
if you find something then i'd log a bug to make it known as well as the fix you get (if any)
may i talk to u in private?
